title-part.text: LUBRICATING OF MACHINES OR ENGINES IN GENERAL

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the notes preceding class F01, specially as regards Note (3).
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: pumps in general F04; lubricating pumps per se F16N

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the type of pump
characterised by the pump driving means

title-part.text: using pressure in working cylinder or crankcase to operate lubricant feeding devices
Lubricating systems characterised by the provision therein of crankshafts or connecting rods with lubricant passageways, e.g. bores
Lubricating systems characterised by the provision therein of lubricant jetting means
Lubricating systems characterised by the provision therein of lubricant venting or purifying means, e.g. of filters

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by the purification means combined with other functions
characterised by the type of purification
characterised by the layout of the purification arrangements
comprising a plurality of filters, parallel or serial
comprising drains for oil to the carter, e.g. to recover spilled oil during change of filters
comprising an oil pick-up tube to oil pump, e.g. strainer

title-part.text: Closed-circuit lubricating systems not provided for in groups F01M1/02 - F01M1/10

reference.text: rendering machines or engines inoperative or idling on lubricant pressure failure F01M1/22

CPC-specific-text.text: according to fuel dilution in oil

title-part.text: rendering machines or engines inoperative or idling on pressure failure
Lubrication specially adapted for engines with crankcase compression of fuel-air mixture or for other engines in which lubricant is contained in fuel, combustion air, or fuel-air mixture

reference.text: separating lubricant from air or fuel-air mixture before entry into cylinder F01M11/08

title-part.text: with variable proportion of lubricant to fuel, lubricant to air, or lubricant to fuel-air-mixture
Heating, cooling, or controlling temperature of lubricant

reference.text: arrangement of lubricant coolers in engine cooling system F01P11/08

title-part.text: Conditioning lubricant for aiding engine starting, e.g. heating

CPC-specific-text.text: Oil sump with partition for facilitating heating of oil during starting
by prelubricating, e.g. using an accumulator

title-part.text: Lubrication means specially adapted for machine or engine running-in
Lubrication means having pertinent characteristics not provided for in, or of interest apart from, groups F01M1/00 - F01M7/00
having means for introducing additives to lubricant
Lubrication of valve gear or auxiliaries

CPC-specific-text.text: of rotary slide or sleeve valves

title-part.text: Non-pressurised lubrication, or non-closed-circuit lubrication, not otherwise provided for
Component parts, details or accessories, not provided for in, or of interest apart from, groups F01M1/00 - F01M9/00

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for improving the stiffness
with special means for guiding the return of oil into the sump
for accommodating movement or position of engines
with special anti-turbulence means, e.g. anti-foaming means or intermediate plates
with passages in the wall, e.g. for axles or fluid passages
Oil pickup tube to oil pump, e.g. strainer
with the oil pump integrated or fixed to sump
Sump being made of different parts
for lubricating auxiliaries, e.g. pumps or turbo chargers
between oil sump and cylinder head

title-part.text: Mounting or connecting of lubricant purifying means relative to the machine or engine

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising pumps for the cooling circuit

title-part.text: Filling or draining lubricant of or from machines or engines

CPC-specific-text.text: Sump drainage devices, e.g. valves, plugs
with a device facilitating the change of oil
with a device defining the lubricant level during filling
with combustion of used lubricant in the engine
with a lubricant cartridge for facilitating the change

title-part.text: Means for keeping lubricant level constant or for accommodating movement or position of machines or engines

CPC-specific-text.text: Means for keeping lubricant level constant
Accommodating movement or position of machines or engines, e.g. dry sumps

title-part.text: Separating lubricant from air or fuel-air mixture before entry into cylinder

CPC-specific-text.text: for indicating the necessity to change the oil
by considering speed, e.g. revolutions per minute [RPM]
by considering magnetic properties of the oil
with systems regulating the pressure in the carter
with a de-icing or defrosting system
Engine parameters used for crankcase breather systems

title-part.text: by means of additional source of positive or negative pressure

CPC-specific-text.text: with an inlet-conduit via an air-filter
with pumps sucking air or blow-by gases from the crankcase
with a turbo charger or compressor

title-part.text: having means for purifying air before leaving crankcase, e.g. removing oil

CPC-specific-text.text: arranged in covering members apertures, e.g. caps
Separating oil and gas with a centrifuge device
the centrifuge device having no rotating part, e.g. cyclone
with a deflection device, e.g. screen
with means for accommodating movement or position of engines
using compression or decompression of the gas
with a de-icing or defrosting system
with oil trap in the return conduit to the crankcase

title-part.text: specially adapted for submersible engines, e.g. of armoured vehicles
